basics.name: Samuel Hebenstreit
basics.label: Data Scientist and Python Programmer
basics.summary: I am a recent physics master's graduate from Montana State University. My graduate research focused on determining the structure, dynamics, and chemistry of the Milky Way Galactic halo.

education.institution: Colorado Mesa University, Grand Junction, CO

highlights: Use large DDO51 photometric survey to analyze the structure and chemistry of the Milky Way Galactic halo
Use data mining techniques to find trends within survey data
Calculate metallicities for all giant stars in the survey and determine rough distances
Create metallicity distribution functions (MDFs)
Determine what MDFs can tell us about accretion history of the Milky Way
Searched for optimum “schemes” to estimate unknown parameters associated with quantum evolutions
Used Mathematica to calculate quantum Fisher information for evolutions
Compared multiple evolution “channels” with correlated and uncorrelated spin-1/2 particles to maximize quantum Fisher information
Presented research in a poster session to a diverse audience
Examined the interactions of lipid vesicles with drugs, antimicrobial peptides, and iron nanoparticles
Became proficient with SEM, TEM, and spectrofluorometer
Prepared samples of lipids in solution for experimentation
Meet with high school and college students for one-on-one physics and math tutoring
Instructed freshman and sophomore physics labs
Graded homework assignments
Held office hours to assist with coursework and conceptual understanding
Ran recitation sessions to reinforce or correct understanding of material
Taught accelerated Summer course
Obtained an advanced understanding of email servers (local and cloud) and email filtering methodologies
Focused on operation and maintenance of numerous types of servers
Became proficient in configuring local/cloud servers using command prompts and Windows PowerShell
Acted as project manager for deployments of Office 365, email filtering, anti-virus, and remote monitoring software
Instructed freshman mechanics and electromagnetism physics labs
Helped students understand underlying concepts in physics and mathematics
Assisted students with assigned coursework

poster.institution: Mapping photometric metallicities in the Galactic halo using DDO51 photometry
poster.studyType: 232nd Meeting of the American Astronomical Society

outreachevents.description: A competition for middle and high schoolers based on egg containers dropped from a 51 foot tall cherry picker on the university plaza. Schools from the area (as well as passing college students) were invited to watch and participate. As president of the physics club, I was a primary organizer and announcer for the event.

Very much like the egg drop, but not a competition. Pumpkins were dropped from the same height as the egg drop. The event was a fun way to get children and college students excited about physics.  I was a primary organizer.

extracurricular.institution: Colorado Mesa University Society of Physics Students
extracurricular.title: President
extracurricular.studyType: Led each meeting (which occurred biweekly during the Fall and Spring semesters). Organized community events such as the pumpkin and egg drops.

extracurricular.institution: Society of Physics Students National Council
extracurricular.title: Associate Zone Councilor
extracurricular.studyType: Helped to select outstanding SPS chapters in Zone 14. Served on a committee to develop a database of Sigma Pi Sigma members who are available speak publicly.

extracurricular.institution: Colorado Mesa University Society of Physics Students
extracurricular.title: Vice President
extracurricular.studyType: Planned a physics demonstration for every club meeting. Helped prepare for community events.

awards.title: President’s List
awards.summary: Maintained a 4.0 grade point average for four semesters

awards.title: Dean’s List
awards.summary: Received 3.71 point average for one semester

awards.title: Selected to Present Research at APS 2015
Graduate Teaching Assistant of the Year 2018
